review: I have had partial urinary incontinence for years - maybe 10. I had incontinence so severely last week that I urinated on myself twice. Today, a week after a 3-day treatment with Ciprofloxascin, I have complete control of my urinary sphincter. My underwear is dry for the first time in years and I  have no odor! I have no idea how this might have worked, but I am thrilled!

I had left a earlier review when starting.  I was prescribed this medication 500mg twice a day for 5 days. For the first 3 days it gave me a terrible fever, 103, 102.9, 102.8.  I then did research and took a over the counter tylenol with the prescribed medication which helped with the fevers.  This medication also gave me severe nausea, I was only eating two pieces of dry toast twice a day.  I will not be using this medication again, hope it helps others though.  Two weeks out and the infection has gotten a little better but not gone.

I woke up with a severe pain in abdomen, thought it was a sketchy chicken I consumed, nope.  That was Sunday, went to the doctor on Tuesday, prescribed Cipro, took the first one right away, following directions to a T.  Next day with no sleep, but didn't have to go pee 10 times during the night, didn't have any burning sensation to begin with.  I do have a fever, just took my third dose of 500mg 2x's a day for 5 days.  I have a fever of 102.8, I will wait until tomorrow and see if it persists. Will change my rating if it works or harms after finishing prescription

Both my Mother and husband developed C. diff. after taking Cipro for a urinary infection. Both were over 65 and both had hospital stays after taking that drug. My husband had only taken it for 5 days out of the 10 prescribed. I will never take it.
I’m exhausted cannot move off couch. Feel like a train rolled over me. This stuff isn't for me at all!

Cipro worked amazing for me with any of my bladder infections. I am highly allergic to Bactrim (itchy all over my body for weeks). I have Sjogrens and Rheumatoid Arthritis.  They say a lot of people with auto immune disorders have allergic reactions to Bactrim. I'm so happy my doctor prescribes Cipro when I have a bladder infections.

Ciprofloxacin gave me the worst nightmares imaginable I had to quit after the 2nd night.  Also,4 months later I have trigger finger where I can barely move my right index finger and will likely require surgery on it.  I woke up unable to move my finger and it only gets worse everyday.  It is hugely painful to "unlock it" and only works for about 2 hours before having to carry out the procedure again.  I don't believe many younger doctors like prescribing this anymore.  Baclofen is a much safer choice and should certainly be tried first.  I have bad reactions to baclofen as well.  Like really bad.  But at least they go away after a week being off it!

This is the worse antibiotic I have ever taken. I took took it for 4 days. I've only been able to eat very little my stomach is burning, I have cramps, puking. I would not recommend this to my worst enemy. I'm losing weight back. I couldn't take it the 7 days It's too harsh on the system 2 days stopped and still have horrible side effects.

Horrible drug! Very painful skin rashes still bothersome after 1 1/2 years later. Severe tendonitis in legs, arms and hands. Nerve damage in legs and hands. Took cipro 500mg twice per day as directed. Stopped at day five of a ten day Rx, could not tolerate any further. UTI did clear but cipro has damaged me. I am 71 yrs old male.

This medication ciprofloxacin ruined my life, I was prescribed it several times in 2004 and subsequently developed debilitating medical conditions and symptoms that have lasted for 16 years. This med should be taken off the market.

Almost 3 yrs ago I was given Cipro for a maybe infection after a stent was placed in my ureter. After 3 pills I started feeling pulling in my calves. I stopped the Rx. Pulls, leg cramps, left side weakness in my arm and leg, terrible brain fog, confusion, abdominal pain, chest pain up the center, heart palpitations, suicidal thoughts, depression, itching, that some side effects still continue today! Almost 3 years later!!! This is a terrible DRUG FAMILY!! DO NOT TAKE ANY OF THEM!!
I took this ciprofloxacin medicine which has been prescribed twice a day every 12 h (500 mg) for 14 days now is my third day I feel very well no more symptoms  I’m glad works for me

I took Cipro 250 mg for urine infection . One pill two times a day for 5 days. It’s been 2 days after taking the anti-biotic and I can’t control my urine, I have a urine leakage, severe stomach pain and back pain. I fear I now have a kidney infection and urine leakage may never go away.

Took cipro for a UTI.  On the 5th day last pill I fainted.  Had to be ambulanced to nearest hospital.   I ended up with ischemic colitis.  Never had any problem like that before.  I think the ciprofloxicen caused permanent  damage to my bowel.  Will never take it again.  Still having issues after 7 months.

I am always very sick physically. I have interstitial cystitis, menieres disease, MCS and more. I often get bladder infections especially because my IC medicine is put in with a catheter regularly and that makes the urethra more exposed to bacteria even though its all sanitized. Ive also been worse since i got my cystoscopy few months back. However, I've always taken Ciprox for bladder infections and it always works 100% and I have never experienced side effects of any kind. One would think since this medicine is so horrible( according to new information) that a sick person would especially get side effects but it has never happened, not even once. All the other antibiotics i tried for my bladder either didn't work or they made my stomach horrible and i got yeast infections..( note that I put one month in the time of medication because when i get infections i take it for a week and thats enough. However I've been having infections on and off for 12 years)

I took cipro for prostrate infection twice a day and the course was suppose to be for 7 days, by the 4th day I had pain in my back and legs, constipation, insomnia, fog mind, tremors in my hands. Now, I always tired, lost about 20 pounds, I'm very susceptible to cold weather, no longer working. I was very healthy person before I took Cipro awful pill.

Within 10 minutes I'm dizzy and sleepy.  I wake up 2 hours later confused and slightly dizzy.  My upper abdomen feels like I have an ulcer and  I'm extremely nauseous.  I ate an apple and felt better.  Its 3 am and I can't sleep

My first bladder infection. First Drug didn't work. Gave me this ciprofloxacin next, 500mg 2x daily every 12 hr.  First and second night I had night terrors.  I'm allergic to other meds and the doctor told me that there was nothing else, discussed doing one pill in morning.  Talked to pharmacist they suggested take second 7-8 hours after morning dose.  Night terrors tamed.  Finished 5 days - 2 days later my knee extremely painful.  Another two days, I am now leaking urine with no control.  My other knee hurts and hip and elbow.  Saw knee specialist and he stated he could inject cortisone or wait - I opted for inject since my other joints were hurting and I do not want to cause more damage due to walking funny.  My knee pain is almost gone.  My other knee, hip, elbow all gone.  My leakage, gone.All doctors scratched their head with the urine leakage, I am convinced it was the drug.

I'm usually not one to leave a review on a medication. Especially since everyone's body may react differently. However, I needed to share my reaction to this medication ciprofloxacin. I thought that maybe I had come down with the flu. My body is hurting so bad I can barely move. Every joint hurts (including my fingers), muscles feel like they are on fire while something is stabbing them. I have had chills but no fever, Nausea and vomiting, My back hurts and my chest is tight as well. I have almost doubled my water intake so I don't believe it's lack of fluids. I would advise if you are having there's side effects to please stop and contact your Dr. I don't think I have ever felt this bad. But again, not everyone is this same

I am so tired!!! I don't feel like even breathing! My back hurts, my head hurts, dizzy, depressed, mad, sad, my bladder burns, I'm constantly running to the bathroom, and feel like rubbish! I will finish taking what I'm supposed to but I think next time I'll ask if there's something else. This is crazy!!!

Cipro for my bladder infection has worked very well for me. I have taken it twice so far with no major side effects (only burning sensation, foggy etc). It has worked when other antibiotics didn't and cleared the infections completely.
I found that after taking cipro 500mg for a week when I took it my bladder symptoms worsened. Is that normal?  I felt severe urge and pressure  only relieved after a few hours of taking the drug.

I have read some negative comments on here.I do have one really bad allergy  to another specific drug.However, I can tolerate this drug quite well.I was admitted to hospital in 2011 with a very severe bladder infection, and I was given this IV in the arm.Over the years I have had it in tablet form from my GP and only suffered mild side effects.I think it is a good drug.

Cipro (ciprofloxacin):I was given Cipro as I was leaving a hospital where I was treated for a bladder infection. I became confused and nauseous after being on it for 1.5 days and stopped taking it. A little over a week later, I could hardly walk and felt like I had electricity running down my legs. That was followed by stabbing pains in hands and feet, prickling sensations all over my body and patches of burning sensations on my arms, legs and back. It's now almost a year later and I have had to deal with this horror 24/7. Only when I developed overactive bladder along with the neuropathy did I learn Cipro can cause all of my symptoms. My urologist told me this based on my medical history and notifications sent by the FDA to him and other physicians.

Cipro (ciprofloxacin):I took Cipro for a bladder infection which gave me severe burning pain, depression and dark thoughts. I now have severe tendon and joint pains to the extreme that doctors are diagnosing me with chronic arthritis, severe tendonitis, and there are days I can't walk. The FDA has  double black box warning. NOT good, do YOUR research. This Cipro can change your life over night. I never, ever had joint pain until my doctor was careless the day he prescribed this -  the double black box warning had been issued so prescribers take more  care. His staff never paid attention and here I am living with the consequences. RESEARCH CIPRO, you will be well informed and trust me you could save your own life. Doctors prescribe but  it is YOUR health  so be informed

I will NEVER take this ciprofloxacine garbage again!!! I was taking Ambien ( I will also never take it again as well seeing that I takes a full week to get out of your system). Anyways I was told to stop taking the Ambien when I started the Cipro. Well I started the Cipro and the very next day I was excessively drowsy and and horribly depressed!!! Even though I stopped the Ambien. I was so so sleepy I couldn't see straight! I had absolutely no appetite for two weeks , even after stopping the Cipro,. I had lost 10 pounds in 2 weeks from not being able to eat!!!! Besides being extremely sleepy my mood had went downhill pretty fast. I was nauseous, my head pounded and I was also extremely grouchy. None of this started until I started the Cipro. Never ever again. I will stick to Bactrim.
I guess it works...but is the increased heart rate/anxiety, tingling skin, night sweats, difficulty sleeping worth it? Glad I stopped after 3 days.

Was prescribed  ciprofloxacin for a UTI  and had to take it 2 times a day for seven days, I got no side effects or mental health issues but the first day I took I had slight stomach pain but it was barely nothing.  It's best if you eat a good full meal before or right after you take pill and drink A LOT of water that's what I did and I was fine. UTI went away thank  goodness. I hope this helps  anyone

I have had every drug under the sun for persistent UTI 's for last 4 years. I live in UK and never heard of this drug. I was on holiday and had to consult a doctor who gave me this drug. I have had no side effects and I have just finished 7 day course. Infection has gone and I am just waiting to see if this has worked long term.

Cipro (ciprofloxacin):Unfortunately I can no longer take this drug. This has been my go too for years and was always able to fix me. I suffer from  interstitial cystitis, chronic kidney infections and chronic UTI’s. After 11 days on 500mg 2x a day I found myself in the ER, looks as if the bacteria I have is now resistant to this medication. Please be careful when taking this I know how great it can work but your body can also become rejecting of it as well.  It has given me many side affects at times and other times none at all.  Best of luck to my fellow sufferers.

I was prescribed Cipro for a UTI when my lab test indicated I had a bacteria that was resistant to the more commonly prescribed meds.  So I had a three day course, at 250mg twice a day.   It worked perfectly and I had no side effects other than a little bit of drowsiness in the morning on day two. That is it. I'm done with the pills as of last week and I feel great. I am 64 and in good health, and take no other meds.

OMGoodness... I thought I was dead.  I am still going through the side effects as we speak. I don't recommend anyone to use this antibiotic. I am still kind of nervous because I just stop taking the meds a little over 24 hrs ago. Trying to drink as much water as I can to flush it out of my system quickly as possible.  No medication has every made me feel this way out of all of my 39 years.

I’ve had a UTI for the past two weeks now. I was first prescribed macrobid, which didn’t completely get rid of my UTI as I still have urgency and frequency to urinate. I was then prescribed cipro. Didn’t work at all. I have now been prescribed keflex. Fingers crossed.

Severe chronic nerve pain, muscle pain, muscle spasms, muscle weakness, inflammation tendons (tendons proved by MRI)Swelling. Symptoms 7 months and getting worse. Took drug 10 days. Taken drug about 6 times total in 20 years.

This drug is so toxic to anyone other than desk jockeys who walk their dog a few blocks for exercise.   Cleaning houses for a living isn't an Olympic sport, doesn't even burn a ton of calories.  But the tendons around my knees are destroyed from squatting to clean low places.  It's that easy to destroy your body on this antibiotic.  The week duration I was on it I did half a work load.  But no matter, my entire body felt awful and burdened with constant pain.  Even if you sit around all day, if this antibiotic makes your body hurt worse than the infection you're fighting, stop it and call your doc.  I was on it because the first antibiotic didn't work.  So I felt obligated to put up with the havoc my body felt.  Don't.  Just don't. Make your doc find the other available options.  They are out there. This is a strong drug with severe and detrimental side affects .
Cipro (ciprofloxacin):I rate it 6 put of 10.

DANGEROUS. Prescribed this for a very painful bladder infection and was given no warnings. I suffered nearly all the side effects (nausea was the worst) but the 500mg every 12 hours only had an effect for about 6 hours, the infection would they return before it was time to take the next dose. Three days of 40degree celsius fevers, being worn down, very little sleep, uncontrollable shaking, twice each day and I was in a bad way. I'm 59 and have taken antibiotics all my life. Yearly in fact until about 25 years ago when I gave up smoking. Since then I have taken antibiotics maybe four times. The last time was about a year ago for a cat bite down to the bone. Don't recall any side effects. I went private yesterday and got the pills changed.
username: NHS Doc found these on Google

review: POISON....two days on this med & I thought I was going to die. Totally  confused, chills,  fever ( which didn't have before) extreme ab & flank pain.  Sicker than when I started it for a UTI.  Caused a gastritis flareup  and today I now have upper respiratory infection......This medicine is AWFUL, ALL PHARMS are killing us

About 6 hours after my first dose, I developed a rash on my torso, back and front. Also from my armpits to my wrists. My ears were ringing and I was drowsy.  This morning my skin is red, itchy and burning as if I have a sunburn.  I am NOT continuing to take the rest of it, as I'm allergic WILL NOT ever take again, and will discourage others from doing so. Have called physician to change medication.

Only took one 500mg cipro tab, felt weird and drowsy, fell asleep. My gut instinct told me this drug isn't right. After reading of the devastating impact it has had on so many, I'm not taking anymore! Thank goodness for your posts. My legs do feel bit numb thats after taking one tablet! Also I felt sick briefly and hot flush in heart and head. I will try cranberry juice :) Failing that I will try another antibiotic not from this class.
Excellent stuff!Suffered for a few weeks and Cipro fixed with results seen as soon as only one day. Lower back pain also gone. A wonder drug!
Caused severe stomach pain. And have nausea and hemmoroids ongoing. Try something else.

This drug is very dangerous too many and should only be used when there are no other options. I took it several times for back to back UTI's. It caused tremors, insomnia, burning, tingling, numbness and severe muscle twitching in my legs. These symptoms lasted for months!!!!

Hi! So I went to the doctor after 10 days of a terrible UTI. Baking soda, AZO and the generic version, cranberry tablets and juice, lots of water, applied heat and NOTHING helped. My doctor started me on Bactria DS which after 7 days of taking this we discovered I was allergic to the antibiotic so for that week it wasn't helping. My body was rejecting it. I was constipated for 2 weeks, throwing up and broke out with a chest rash. My UTI felt like it was getting worse and like it would never end. I got a culture done at the doctors my second visit and I was put on Cirpofloaxin for 10 days. After the 2nd pill I felt immediate relief. I'm still taking them but on day 4 it was completely gone. $4 later, Im better! :)

Earlier uses were no trouble and worked. The problem is that it depletes your system of magnesium and then your tendons just shred. The effect is cumulative, the more often you take it the more likely it is to hurt you. Be very careful and only take when there isn't an alternative. I have been suffering for three months from the damage it did and it didn't cure the UTI.

Cipro (ciprofloxacin):Cipro is a Fluoroqunilone. The FDA has issued a Black Box Warning -- the most severe warning it can issue -- on all Fluoroquinolone antibiotics because they cause so many horrible, longterm side effects (like permanent tendonitis on multiple parts of the body) that may take years to come to light.

Great stuff. And for those who have had issues with it...guess what..your system is different than mine. That's all. So don't go telling folks it sucks. A Tesla won't run on gasoline, but that doesn't mean gasoline doesn't work.
Would never take this drug again as I have lost the hearing in my "good" ear after the 3rd dose. Will I recover my hearing as at the moment my consultant now classes me as profoundly deaf.

My 3rd day on cipro without hardly any effect. I'm in pain 24/7 like a period. Ready to consult a doctor again. I was in the ER the 6th of May. Still lots of pain. Plus I have stomach issues. No appetite. My entire abdominal area hurts. Nausea.
Cipro (ciprofloxacin):Burning sensation when I pee meant a trip to the Dr. The doctor prescribed Cipro 500mg twice daily for one week. Cleared up the problem quickly.

I was prescribed cipro after the first antibiotic didn't completely work for a UTI.  STAY AWAY FROM THIS DRUG!!!! POISON  PLEASE GOOGLE what has happened to people who have taken this horrible drug that the FDA finally gave it a black box warning.  I have pain in my hips, shoulders and arms b/c of this drug

Have an acute UTI which comes on very very quickly, so have to go to A & E, for intravenous anti biotics. This is the  3rd infection in 3 months but the hospital keep prescribing Ciprofloxacin 500 mgs, fine for a  short while, but the infection starts again, with lots of blood in my urine. I experience dizziness, nausea and some pain. This time, along with the Cipro, I've been prescribed Naproxen. Have an appointment with a urologist soon  and hoping he will prescribe something different and that works. My life is on hold at the moment and totally fed up

Bladder / body infection. Groin swelling and abdominal pain. Prescribed two weeks dosage which cleared symptoms. Ok for one after. Then infection came back. This time same symptoms but now spread to kidney pain also causing lower back pain Re-prescribed further dosage, this time for 4 weeks. Further checks to be done, i.e. Scan & blood test booked. Meanwhile within two weeks, all symptoms now gone again 100%. But carrying on to complete dosage for further two weeks. Final diagnosis likely cause originated from UTI -Urinary tract Infection. I consider this medicine to be suitable but deems to be only of a Mild strength. There were No side effects. And I am generally always very fit never getting any illness's apart from common colds.

End result of two C-sections and a hysterectomy is susceptibility to bladder infections after drinking too much coffee, caffeine or after sex. So I've tried many different remedies, one of which is taking Cipro. The antibiotic works to clear the infection BUT, the horrible yeast infections are unfathomable! I'd rather take more of another antibiotic than deal with the yeast infection which lingers for weeks. Now I have to get an anti fungal to clear up the itching, burning and discharge associated with taking the Cipro. Ugh!

On holiday in Florida (from Canada) and got UTI after many years with no problems.  Cipro was prescribed and although it has helped, the side effects are almost unbearable!  My joints ache, I'm dizzy and nauseous, can't get to sleep and had terrible abdominal and vaginal pain.  Also you can't have dairy or any vitamins 2 hours before to 4 hours after taking the meds.  If this had been my family doctor instead of the doctor's PA at the walk-in clinic I'd certainly give him an earful!!  I'm only half way through the course of meds (required a full 10 days) and will make note of this medicine so that I will NEVER take it again!

I'm taking Novo Cipro for a bladder/kidney infection. I have to take 1 pill, twice a day, 12 hours apart. I think it's working because when I went to the hospital and got diagnosed I could barely walk. 5 days later, I'm fully upright again. & I think I can thank the Cipro & my hot water bag for that!However, there are so many side effects. When I'm not keeling over from the pain from my bladder infection, the abdominal pains set in. I also have a terrible cramp/swelling in my left wrist & arm. The first 3-4 days on this medication, I was exhausted. I could not stay awake for the life of me. My back was hurting, my whole body felt sore. I had a fever, cold sweats at night & migraines!! Terrible migraines!!

Prescribed 7 day treatment for UTI, (2x/day), of Ciprofloxacin 500mg, two months after 6 week course of BCG infusions for  bladder cancer. Only took 11 pills then stopped because of warnings of possible side effects. Then about two weeks after that, started to have pains in right side around right kidney area. Now this week my left side kidney area is aching. Dr. is out of town 'til Monday the 28th of Nov.

8 years ago I had a UTI so bad the 1st round of antibiotics didnt work & that became apparent when blood in my urine was visible to me at home & still in a world of pain. Fortunately they took a culture my 1st visit to discover the bacteria I had would not be killed by what was perscribed....no duh! So they gave me Cipro & within an hour I felt relief. Fast forward 8 years, same situation but exasperated by too much sirracha (chilli sauce), I woke up with pains of a bad UTI. Ran to the doc, I had been drinking too much water for them to detect leukocytes & nitrates but detected blood and sent the culture to the lab. She prophylacticly perscribed Cipro & UTI was gone. I noticed little side effects, maybe some light headedness & tireness but thats about it.

I have had a lot of bladder infections years ago from pregnancies but haven't had one in 4/5 years. The few days ago noticed the symptoms, went to the doc and he prescribed me this. I've always been prescribed amoxacilin and it's worked great. This time he prescribed this because of my history. Took my 1st pill today and within 30 mins started to feel faint, weak and outer body experience. I was at home by myself with my 8 month old baby so I immediately got in the car, drove to the local hospital which is conveniently only 5 mins away and sat in the parking lot. Started to feel better but still not 100%. Called a nurse I know who said i'll be fine but get a diff prescription. I'm going to try taking half for my 2ND dose or else i'll stop

Had a bladder infection for over 2 weeks before doctors found the tablets i was on were the wrong ones for my infection, as a UTI takes many forms.    You must not drink milk or have anything dairy for 2 hours before hand and 2 hours after taking the tablet.   If you drink coffee or tea you must drink the same amount in water afterwards.  Not had any side effects following these rules to a T.    Been told that I need to drink water after every coffee or tea I have now as it's pointing to me damaging my kidneys because  there is blood in the urine, i must follow this for the rest of my life if i want to keep fit.  I live in the UK.The test the hospital did  on my urine sample, showed I was on the wrong treatment as it wouldn't kill that particular bacteria

I've given bad reviews on drugs with awful side effects but I must say this one worked very well for me . Had a very bad bladder/prostate infection with cloudy urine . Had a misdiagnosis so the infection actually festered for 4 months . Body temperature rose and chills set in two hours after taking the first dose . This lasted for 4 days as my body ( antibiotics ) fought the infection . By day 5 was feeling much better . By day 7 best I'd felt in many months . By day 10 urine was totally clear , no more pain , normal urine volume and totally back to normal . What a relief . Benefits far outweigh some minor side effects ( first day some minor dizziness , Little bit of " brain fog " first few days ) 500mg x 2 for 14 days ...................

I caught a urinary tract infection after being sick from stomach flu / virus and was prescribed cipro (500 m). After one pill in the evening, I became tired, went to bed and woke up anxious, depressed, restless, with loss of balance. I've had antibiotics (amoxacillin i think) once in the past, but never had anything like this kind of reaction. Waiting for a call from my doctor for a different medicine.

I took Cipro for 5 days.  It made me sick!  I nausea, body aches, chills, diahrea, head aches, dizziness!  My uti is gone.   i took the last pill 2 days ago and the drug hasnt completely left my body yet!  Im not taking cipro ever again!

Cipro (ciprofloxacin):I took Cipro for only three days for a bladder infection. I was left with ankle/tendon pain and diahrrea for three months. I had no clue what was happening to me. Turns out lots have had the same reaction to this class of antibiotic.

Within hours of taking the generic Cipro and AZO I felt much better. I was only having pain and urgency the morning before I went to doc. I'm on day 3 and the past two days I've been lethargic, groggy and bloated. First night had some anxiety but I think that's from reading the side effects before going to sleep (eeek). I have had some mood swings as well. Hopefully I only need to take it for 5 days instead of 7- waiting for my lab result of how severe the infection was- I hate taking antibiotics.

I was experiencing pain in my right kidney, It wasn't a sharp pain, but more of a dull achy pain that was just uncomfortable. It went away the next day but would come back every other day. I then started to feel the beginning stages of a UTI coming on so I correlated the 2 together. the dr. took a urine sample but results have not come back yet. She says she thinks I have a bladder infection spreading to my kidney so she prescribed me cipro. After looking it up I read cipro is good for UTI, kidney and bladder infections so it should work perfectly fine. After my second pill my UTI was cleared up (hallelujah), but after taking 3 days my pain in my kidney is more constant than ever and stays 24/7 now. I hope it goes away soon!

I've been on Ciprofloxcin for 3 days now for a urinary tract infection and I don't know what's worst...the pain from the actual infection or the horrible feeling this medication has given me. Every time I take it it gives me a headache, I feel drained and dizzy and give me this restless anxiety attack feeling. I hope that at the end of my 7 day cycle it will be worth it but so far I feel worst than better.

I got a UTI and was prescribed Cipro because I am allergic to Sulfa drugs. It took care of the UTI quickly, but I can't wait to get off it. I have two days left. I feel achy, tired, have indigestion and had nightmares. I read the side effects and they are all on there. Also, I cannot take any of my other medications because of potential reactions. I don't have any other choices, but I don't feel well on this drug.

I have taken this medication several times for UTI'S and it works great! No side effects at all! I am on it now for a bladder infection! and I have  had reieif within the first couple of hours. It's great

2nd pill of 500mg bad side effects - I am Canadian - tingling in thumb - lips numb - eyes stinging - brain fog - neck.throat area weird feeling - like to touch it feels like you're not touching it with your hand - this drug is obviously POISON - a definite neurotoxin and should not be available for any ones consumption!!!!

Call me crazy but I think it worked after only one day. Only mild bloating/gas as a side effect. I'll finish it as prescribed but - seriously, it's fine. I took it with full meals and it worked like a charm!

I loved this Medication! It helped honestly within maybe a day or so, downfall I got a yeast infection from it but I've gotten em before on antibiotics so I wasn't too surprised or shocked but other than that this Medication worked fine, I used it for bladder infection plus I had to use it before a kidney stone procedure as well ! Love it !

I had to go to the doctor yesterday with urgency, I was diagnosed with a Urinary track infection, and vaginosis all the same time, and probably herpes as well, I haven't rated this yet because I just started the treatment.  I have to take them every 12 hours for 7 days. I really hope it relieves by tomorrow, this is the worst pain ever, I wouldn't desire this to anyone.  It is the living hell unfortunately. I can't even walk straight because of how bad it is. I've been crying like never before. The only way I noticed it hurts less to pee for me is when you are in the shower inclined forward. Like I said hopefully tomorrow the itching and burning goes away!

I am not sure after 10 days (as instructed) that the UTi is completely gone.  But I do not want to take any more of this med as I have had sore shoulders and hips as well as mood swings during treatment.  I have Lupus and I feel that to continue cipro would be dangerous for me

Best med ever for bladder infections. I thought I'd never leave the house but after the first dose I felt better in 4 hours. After the 2nd dose I feel almost back to normal. I've taken this med a LOT in my life with no side effects. Take it with food and plenty of water if you can.
didn't seem to really help all that much

Use D-Mannose... I was prone to lots of bladdef/Urinary tract infections after taking cipro. I found google post on D-Mannose  and it worked great. I used it in powder for and it looks and tastes like powder sugar. Take a teaspoon  mixed in water daily and you will NEVER have another infection.. Read up on it and on ciprofloxacin and don't ever take it.

Ohhhhh where do I start! Well, I had the bladder infection for 3 days prior to going to the doctors. He prescribed me with cipro and the infection stayed the same. I gained many other side affects to this antibiotic to add to the wonderful pain and discomfort I was already in... nausea, diarrhea, headaches, and sharp stomach pains. Not impressed for I paid a whopping amount of 30 dollars! Not satisfied!!

If I could rate this drug lower then 1 I would. Last year my mother went to a local hospital to be treated for a routine bladder infection. A clearly untrained nurse gave my mother this drug, and she took 1 pill that afternoon. Within 45 minutes she had collapsed and had gone in to anaphylactic shock. The drug caused a chain reaction in her blood and she suffered total kidney failure.She spent 3 weeks in an intensive care unit, on the brink of death.Her whole body swelled with edema from around 76kgs to over 120kgs in the time she was in hospital, she couldn't move and had to be fed intravenously.Luckily she recovered and left hospital 4 weeks later.

Cipro (ciprofloxacin):Second day into a 7 day cycle ...within the first 15 to 20 minutes ciprofloxacin gives me phantom sensations like flea bites..nothing major it goes away shortly after. The blood is clearing up in my urine but still a mild pain in my right flank. Hopefully this stuff gets rid of the bacteria for good. Feels like it is..other than a sour stomach it seems to be working

Cipro (ciprofloxacin):Started taking for bladder infection, got to day 2 of taking the medication when it started giving me random sharp stomach pains (wasn't having any dairy products either) and caused me to have panic attacks where I felt extremely dizzy. I had to ask for another medication.

I've been prescribed Cipro several times and have never had a problem with the drastic side effects others have posted here. I usually have 60% relief within 6 hours of taking the first pill. By day two, the burning is pretty much gone. The frequency and bloating slowly resolve during the rest of the treatment days. I use AZO to help with pain at the onset, but usually only need to take 1 dose before the Cipro kicks in.

Cipro (ciprofloxacin):I have to be on it for 2 months due to surgery and chronic bladder infection..women..please eat something and take a probiotic with this medicine. Working great! No complaints and no yeast infection..yay!

Cipro (ciprofloxacin):Cipro worked the first day for reducing the urgency, but I must not have eaten enough, because I felt like vomiting. The second day I had diarrhea, and the third day, I have the urgency back, but not as painful.

I took Cipro (500mg 2x/day) for a bladder infection and the only side effect I got was some drowsiness. A few days into taking it, I made the mistake of reading medication reviews and I thought for sure it was going to slowly kill me. Well, I don't know if any other side effects are going to creep up on me in the future, but I can assure you that the actual course of medicine worked just the way it was supposed to, with no serious side effects. The conclusion--there are either a ton of people with pyschosomatic tendencies or I am some sort of anomaly.

Cipro (ciprofloxacin):This medicine gave me the relief of symptoms of pain, urgency and frequency I needed quickly but I felt bad otherwise with overall fatigue and joint pain everywhere.  Seven Days of that was worth it to me to rid me of that infection.  But I worry if those side effects could worsen if I use it again in the future.

I have very frequent bladder infections and I take Cipro. It always works except for this time. I took it twice yesterday as prescribed but I woke up every hour last night having to go. I've never had a problem with it not working, but maybe I'm developing an immunity to it because of the amount I get bladder infections.
Cipro worked great for my urinary tract infection after 3 days of taking it I was back to normal. I would definitely ask your doctor for it if you have a UTI.
Cipro is great! I feel relief after an hour of taking it but I also take Cranberry pills on the first couple doses to help with flushing... Pain is minimal after the first dose along with frequency.

Cipro (ciprofloxacin):I love Cipro. I have had it several times before for a bladder infection, and again recently after passing a kidney stone. It works so fast. I have nothing bad to say about it, in fact I have noticed that my skin has cleared up, I know it isn't for that but my skin has never been this clear.

Cipro (ciprofloxacin):This medicine gave me quick relief from the urinary tract infection, however I am vomiting and have diarrhea. The pharmacist label said to take on an empty stomach but when I called them, they said I can eat just no dairy.  Hopefully with something in my stomach the side effects will decrease.

Cipro works great for me and is what I ask for.  I've always been given 500 mg twice a day.  Knocks out the pain and burning within 24 hours.  For those who say they always get a yeast infection... take a supplement of acidophilus every day to replenish the good bacteria in your system.  You won't get the yeast infection if you do this.  Take it several days after stopping the Cipro, and you'll be good to go!

Cipro (ciprofloxacin):I took one dose and within about 3 hours the blood started to clear from the urine and pain lessened; however, soon I got a bad headache, nausea, and chills.  Within about 12 hours from the first (and only)dose I was in the hospital--vomiting and feeling miserable.  Was there for 3 days taking a different antibiotic and fluids by IV.  One week later bad diahrrea, and pain in knee joint.  Must be allergic to Cipro--will remember that for sure!

Four days ago I started on Cipro for urinary tract infection. I am allergic to Bactrim. I have taken it before. It is very effective and fast acting, However, this evening I started having side effects. Both legs from about 6" above the knee, down through my feet, ache, tingle, and sting like I have a band around my thigh cutting off circulation. I called the office that prescribed it, due to printout from the pharmacy. He just says if I am concerned, go to the ER. So I am going off it, and waiting to see what happens. I have 6 pills left.

Felt relief within 3 hours of taking it! Three days into it, I still feel the urgency to "go", but the pain and all other symptoms are gone. I too have headaches, but they are minimal. Medication insert said you can take vitamins/iron after a minimum of 2 hours of taking Cipro and I can live without milk for 10 days. Hang in there, I freaked out after reading the "warnings", but so far, so good.

Cipro (ciprofloxacin):I had a major bladder infection and was prescribed Cipro.  I had diarrhea and dizzy spells the entire time I took this medicine.  I told my new primary doctor to prescribe Amoxicillin.  He told me that Cipro is better.  My former doctor prescribed Amoxil and I never had problems with that medicine.
Cipro (ciprofloxacin):Had a bad allergic reaction to this medication after 2 pills and stopped taking it.  Asked for another DIFFERENT medication.

I was prescribed Cipro after having a SEVERE bladder infection. Within 3-4 hours, I started feeling relief, by 12 hours I was almost completely better. Be sure to take all of the medication, or it may come back worse. Overall, Cipro worked like a charm and gave me almost instant relief.

Cipro (ciprofloxacin):Caused severe allergic reaction when I had never had a reaction to any medication before. Had to be hospitalized. Doctor said he has been seeing more and more allergic reactions to Cipro.

I've had a couple bladder infections. This is the first time I've taken Cipro. It did it's job and got rid of the infection and relieved my symptoms pretty quickly.  But the side effects made it so I couldn't wait to be done with the medicine. It made my knees ache, gave me terrible, terrible headaches and made me extremely tired. Also, it was quite agitating not being able to take my vitamins or with milk. I am grateful to have my bladder infection gone, but these side effects were not enjoyable.

Cipro is the only medicine that cures my resistent bladder infections. One doctor prescribed 10 days of Bactrim, but it didn't work. After 10 days on the Bactrim and being miserable and in considerable pain, I was prescribed Cipro (three pills for three days). After taking the second Cipro pill, my symptoms were completely gone! Cipro is truly a wonder medicine for me.

Cipro is the only thing that gets rid of my bladder infections. It is fantastic and I ask for it whenever I get a bladder infection. I do notice that I need to take it hours apart from my hypothyroid medication, or else it decreases the effectiveness of my thyroid medicines.  But Cipro is the only thing that cures my bladder infections.

I have a dual urinary tract system and as a result have had many urinary tract infections and kidney/bladder infections over the years with several operations. Ciprofloxacin has always been the medicine prescribed by my urologist and/or doctors. I would not use another medicine as this gives minimal side effects and my issues are rectified.  You must drink and continue to drink plenty of water.

I have had a lifetime of bladder infections and ciprofloxacin (although a little annoying because of the dairy and iron) it works wonders! By the second dose the pain is 95% gone. My advice take it with a handful of Cheerios and first thing in the morning and about 11 hours later at night when you haven't had too much dairy (like a glass of milk or a steak). I had no side effects and I always get it for at least one week to 10 days. I've taken just about every other one and I've had the infections come back. Ciprofloxacin is always my first choice!

2 -250 mg for 3 days. Worked great! Left me very tired, lightly nauseous and a little heartburn (and perhaps developing a little yeast infection) but nothing I can't handle. I got great night of sleep but my days were bad. I did get freaked out by some of the reviews I read but I had to remember that hundreds, if not thousands, of people take this medicine and only the ones with bad reactions will post anything (only a fraction of the people prescribed it). It works differently with everyone so do not let these reviews make your mind up. Take it one pill at a time and see how it affects you. Tip: take the pill with a lot of water and food in your belly. This helped me. Good luck!
Cipro (ciprofloxacin):It made my whole body hurt specially my joints and my ankles
Cipro (ciprofloxacin):Caused me violent abdominal pain, flank pain, nausea, and headache.  After 3 days, I called my doctor for a different medicine.

Cipro (ciprofloxacin):I had to stop taken the medicine due to getting yellowing of the skin, fevers, nightmares, severe headaches, dizziness, hot flashes, restlessness, nausea, etc. The medicine was fine until about 3 days into it then I began to feel worse and it was even hard for me to breathe. I may be one of the select few who reacted this way and I followed everything that I was told to do exactly.

Cipro (ciprofloxacin):I am on my 3rd day of taking ciprofloxacin and it's working great. Although I do get intense headaches but I would rather that short term rather than have the constant feeling of needing 2 go 2 the toilet.

Cipro (ciprofloxacin):Cipro is magical when it comes to bladder infections.   Please do not drink milk and please make sure you eat a cracker, a piece of bread or other food prior to taking this medication. It is by far the strongest and most effective for severe bladder infections. Within just hours you no longer feel that constant annoying urgency to urinate and the pain of the oncoming infection lessens the first day of taking Cipro. And, lastly, however most importantly, do not have intercourse for at least a week or longer.

Cipro (ciprofloxacin):It's been three days since I've been on this medicine. First time user also. I never had a bladder infection but it got a lot better than it was the first day with the burning and pain. I am still experiencing a bit of the burning. I am hoping it works and takes it fully away about the time its my last dose. At first this medicine made me nauseous and tired but I drank more water and it seemed to help take that away.
Cipro (ciprofloxacin):Used this for bladder infection, works great no side effects, cleared up in 7 days.

Cipro (ciprofloxacin):I have become very sensitive to ingredients in certain drinks and products. I can no longer take bubble baths or use body washes (anything with scents). I also can't drink any of the energy drinks. From the first time I feel the symptoms (frequency, pain, "full" feeling), it's usually gone straight to my kidneys and I'm urinating with blood in the urine. Over the counter mediines don't work with me. The doctor gives me Cipro and Pyridine (for pain/turns urine orange) and it knocks it out fast and completely. Depending on the dose (I get higher for kidneys than just straight bladder), it can wipe out all bacteria (good/bad) and cause a yeast infection. I've been lucky and only have had one.
Cipro (ciprofloxacin):It works every time, however takes about 3-4 hours to provide relief. The only reason why I don't give it a 10 is because it gives me yeast infections every time.
Cipro (ciprofloxacin):I was recently prescribed this medication and it did not work at all for me.

I have frequent bladder infections/UTIs. I have always, with the exception of a one-time prescription to Augmentin, taken Cipro. It gets rid of the infection, but I have concerns about frequent, long-term use of the drug. I have taken Cipro for THREE different illnesses, so it's very versatile, however it tends to give me a yeast infection.
Cipro (ciprofloxacin):It always works!

I have had a horrible and painful UTI/bladder infection for 8 days now. At the beginning I was given another antibiotic for 3 days. It basicaly did nothing. I went back about 3 days ago and was given ciprofloxacin. I have been taking it for 3 days and today is my last day. I have 1 more pill to go. Today is the 1st day that I feel a lot better. I have no urgency, no pain, but a slight tenderness. Im praying and praying that this will work. I give a big thank you to ciprofloxacin.
Cipro (ciprofloxacin):I had a very serere bladder infection. My urologist prescribed Cipro and it worked like a charm. I didn't suffer any side effects.
